bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Herbert Putnam, April 24, 1928

div1.p: Carter thanks Putnam and his staff for providing her with a library card that will allow her access to the shelves of the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Herbert Putnam, April 24, 1928
div1.opener:
Book
File Library of Congress
DIVISION
//////
-------------
The Westmoreland,
2122 California Street, N. W.
Washington D. C.
April 24, 1928.
Dear Doctor Putnam:
div1.p:
Please accept my most grateful thanks for the helpful
kindness and courtesy shown me last Saturday by yourself and your
staff, in regard to my contemplated bibliographic work on the
History of Yellow Fever by my Father, the late Assistant Surgeon
General Henry Rose Carter.

My thanks are equally due you for the card, which I
find awaiting me here on my return from an out of town consultation,
permitting me access to the shelves containing works I shall need aerfor
reference.
div1.closer:
Once more, with deepest appreciation, I remain
Sincerely and gratefully yours. Laura A. Carter Dr. Herbert Putnam,
Librarian,
Library of Congress,
Washington, D. C.
